page.title: 08SOMERSHAM CARNIVAL (1)
page.content: SOMERSHAM HOLDS ITS CARNIVAL EVERY YEAR IN JUNE.IT COMMENCES WITH A DANCE AND BARBECUE FOR ADULTS ON THE FRIDAY EVENING, DURING WHICH THE CARNIVAL QUEEN IS SELECTED. ON THE SATURDAY EVENTS BEGIN WITH A PROCESSION THROUGH THE TOWN. ALL LOCAL CLUBS, GROUPS AND ORGANISATIONS ARE ENCOURAGED TO DECORATE A FLOAT USUALLY AROUND A GENERAL THEME. IN 1985 THE THEME WAS T.V. PROGRAMMES. THE FLOATS ARE LED BY THE SOMERSHAM TOWN BAND AND FOLLOWED BY A COLLECTION OF VINTAGE CARS. THEY LEAVE THE NORTH END OF THE TRUNDLE, AT 1.30, GO THROUGH FEOFFEES ROAD, HIGH STREET, PARKHALL ROAD TO THE PLAYING FIELD. AFTERWARDS THE STALLS AND SIDESHOWS OPEN WITH PRIZES FOR THE BEST FLOAT AND THE MOST OUTSTANDING MOTORISED VEHICLE OVER 25 YEARS OLD. FANCY DRESS COMPETITIONS FOR THE UNDER FIVES, 6 - ll YEARS AND (CONT.)
